article_title: HHS Urges DC Circ. To Revive Indemnity Insurance Rules
article_text:
HHS Urges DC Circ. To Revive Indemnity Insurance Rules

Law360, Washington (April 15, 2016, 5:10 PM ET) -- The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services pushed a D.C. Circuit panel Friday to revive rules limiting fixed indemnity insurance plans to people already covered under the Affordable Care Act, arguing a lower court misinterpreted HHS' ability to protect consumers under the statute.



At a hearing Friday, the agency said U.S. District Judge Royce C. Lamberth’s decision to nix the HHS regulations would doom a provision meant to protect consumers from purchasing the incorrect kind of insurance only to realize it after becoming sick....
